content: monstera leaf free crochet pattern pattern created by amanda noel make things make art find me on ravelry ribblr and lovecrafts linktr ee/makethings makeart materials 3 5mm crochet hook aunt lydia s size 10 mercerized cotton pattern notes i used two threads of aunt lydia s crochet thread with a 3 5mm hook to get a thicker and more stiff final result you can use any yarn/hook combo - but i would use a hook size that is smaller than recommended on the label of your yarn this pattern is not worked in straight row we will work the center vein and then work in row to complete one side work back down the center vein and repeat on the other side as a rule you will always greate chains towards the outside of the leaf and then crochet the row towards the center ending with a slip_stitch to the center vein moving on to the other side once you get to the top start turning to create slip_stitch the end of that last row to the one side of the leaf beginning of the center vein slip_stitch all the way along until you get to the top again along the right side of the vein then repeat this pattern to create the other side same pattern of turning but mirrored chain direction start here create the center vein crocheted row direction pattern chain 25 row 1 single_crochet 24 along the chain until ou reach the end row 2 chain 1 turn 1sc 1hdc 4dc 1hdc 1sc slip_stitch row 3 chain 6 turn slip_stitch into the top of the leaf turn single_crochet half_double_crochet 5dc * slip_stitch 2 stitches down from where you chained 6 *everything in brackets is crocheted into the chain space row 4 chain 8 turn slip_stitch into the half_double_crochet from the previous row turn single_crochet half_double_crochet 8dc * slip_stitch 2 stitches down from where you chained 8 *everything in brackets is crocheted into the chain space row 5 chain 8 turn slip_stitch into the 5th double_crochet counting from the center/base chain of single_crochet from the previous row turn single_crochet half_double_crochet 10dc * slip_stitch 2 stitches down from where you chained 8 *everything in brackets is crocheted into the chain space row 6 chain 10 turn slip_stitch into the 9th double_crochet counting from the base chain of single_crochet from the previous row turn single_crochet half_double_crochet 14dc * slip_stitch 2 stitches down from where you chained 8 *everything in brackets is crocheted into the chain space row 7 chain 12 turn slip_stitch into the 12th double_crochet counting from the base chain of single_crochet from the previous row turn single_crochet half_double_crochet 15dc * slip_stitch into the end of the base chain *everything in brackets is crocheted into the chain space we will now repeat this process on the other side turn your work so that you are working
